title: Case Analysis: Lois and James Sumpter
description: Applying the Power and Control Wheel to a real case, seeing how the concepts you've learned manifest in actual experiences of intimate partner violence.

content.narration: Now we apply what we've learned to reality. The Sumpter case brings the Power and Control Wheel to life, showing how abstract concepts become lived experiences. This is difficult terrain—the deepest part of the surface zone—but understanding real cases prepares you to recognize patterns in the people you'll encounter.

sections.title: Preparing to Review a Real Case
sections.content:
## Case Analysis: Lois and James Sumpter

It can be difficult to imagine all of the elements you've learned happening in a real-life scenario. In this section, you review the case of Lois and James Sumpter.

**Content Warning:**

This case includes real audio of abuse and may be difficult to listen to or read. If you find engaging with this content too difficult or jarring, you can skip the audio portions and follow along with the written descriptions, or you may choose to take breaks as needed.

**What You'll Learn:**

As you review the case, you will be guided through the audio and timeline of the events that occurred. This case will help you:

- See how the Power and Control Wheel manifests in real situations
- Understand how different types of abuse work together over time
- Recognize patterns that may not be obvious from isolated incidents
- Apply the concepts you've learned to actual experiences

sections.title: Analyzing the Case Through the Power and Control Wheel
sections.content:
## Identifying Patterns and Tactics

As you engage with the Sumpter Case, think about the types of abuse you encounter. Consider these questions:

**Types of Abuse:**
- What types of abuse can you identify in this case?
- How do different forms of abuse overlap and reinforce each other?
- Which behaviors fit into physical, emotional, economic, or sexual abuse categories?

**Power and Control:**
- How does James Sumpter create and use a power imbalance?
- Which sections of the Power and Control Wheel do you see represented?
- How do the tactics on the inside of the wheel relate to the violence on the outside?

**The Pattern:**
- Is this intimate terrorism, situational couple violence, or violent resistance?
- What evidence helps you make this determination?
- How does the timeline reveal escalation or patterns of control?

### What the Case Illustrates

This case exemplifies how the Power and Control Wheel can be used to illustrate to survivors how what they experience contributes to an environment in which a person who causes harm creates and uses a power imbalance to gain control in the relationship.

For professionals like James providing IPV advocacy or Maria conducting intake assessments, being able to recognize these patterns is essential for trauma-informed support.

sections.title: Applying Your Knowledge
sections.content:
## Using the Tools You've Learned

The Sumpter case demonstrates how the tools you've learned in this module come together:

**The Power and Control Wheel** helps you:
- Identify specific tactics being used
- See how behaviors on the inside of the wheel create a foundation for violence on the outside
- Understand the systematic nature of abuse

**Types of Abuse** understanding helps you:
- Recognize that abuse takes many forms beyond physical violence
- See how different types compound and reinforce each other
- Identify early warning signs before escalation occurs

**Johnson's Typology** helps you:
- Categorize the pattern of violence
- Understand the context and dynamics of the relationship
- Provide appropriate resources and support

### Moving Forward

As you complete Module 1, you now have foundational knowledge about:
- What intimate partner violence is and who it affects
- The different types of abuse and how they overlap
- How power and control function in abusive relationships
- Different categories of relationship violence
- How these concepts apply to real cases

This foundation prepares you for Module 2, where you'll explore the intersection of intimate partner violence and sexual violence—moving deeper into the iceberg's hidden depths.

keyTakeaways: Real cases like the Sumpter case help illustrate how theoretical concepts manifest in actual experiences
The Power and Control Wheel helps identify specific tactics and patterns in real situations
Multiple types of abuse work together and compound over time in intimate terrorism
Analyzing timelines reveals patterns and escalation that may not be obvious from single incidents
Understanding real cases prepares professionals to recognize similar patterns in their work
The tools learned in Module 1 work together to provide a comprehensive understanding of IPV dynamics

activities.title: Case Application
activities.prompt: What is the primary purpose of using the Power and Control Wheel to analyze cases like the Sumpter case?
options: To assign legal blame to the person who causes harm
To illustrate to survivors how their experiences contribute to an environment where power imbalance creates control
To determine if the survivor should have left the relationship sooner
To prove that physical violence is the most important type of abuse
activities.explanation: The Power and Control Wheel can be used to ILLUSTRATE TO SURVIVORS how what they experience contributes to an environment in which a person who causes harm creates and uses a power imbalance to gain control in the relationship. This helps survivors see their experience more clearly, validates that what they're experiencing is abuse, and can help them understand why leaving is so difficult. It's not about blame—it's about recognition and understanding.

activities.title: Pattern Recognition
activities.prompt: Why is reviewing a timeline of events important when analyzing cases of intimate partner violence?
options: To determine the exact date when abuse started
To assign a severity score to each incident
To reveal patterns and escalation that may not be obvious from isolated incidents
To create legal evidence for prosecution
activities.explanation: Reviewing a TIMELINE reveals PATTERNS and ESCALATION that may not be obvious from looking at isolated incidents. IPV is a pattern of behaviors, and seeing how events unfold over time helps identify the systematic nature of abuse, shows how different tactics build on each other, and demonstrates escalation. This understanding is critical for trauma-informed assessment and safety planning.

activities.title: Integration of Tools
activities.prompt: How do the different tools you learned in Module 1 (Power and Control Wheel, Types of Abuse, Johnson's Typology) work together?
options: They contradict each other and should be used separately
They provide different perspectives that together create a comprehensive understanding of IPV dynamics
Only the Power and Control Wheel is necessary for understanding IPV
They are used for different populations and should never be combined
activities.explanation: The tools learned in Module 1 work TOGETHER to provide a COMPREHENSIVE understanding of IPV dynamics. The Power and Control Wheel shows specific tactics and their systematic nature; understanding Types of Abuse helps recognize different forms and how they overlap; Johnson's Typology helps categorize patterns and provide appropriate support. Using these tools together—as demonstrated in the Sumpter case—creates a fuller, more nuanced understanding than any single tool alone.
